ppm_java.typelib

Class VAudioProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ppm_java.typelib.VBrowseable
      • ppm_java.typelib.VAudioObject
        • ppm_java.typelib.VAudioProcessor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TNodeConverterDb, TNodeIntegrator_PPMBallistics, TNodePeakEstimator, TNodePPMProcessor, TNodePump, VAudioDriver, VFrontend

    public abstract class VAudioProcessor
extends VAudioObject
    Base class for all modules processing audio samples. An audio processor can have any number of inputs and any number of outputs. Mostly, an audio processor receives sample data from its input ports, does some work with the sample data and pushes the result to its output ports. Some audio processors only receive data (e.g. VFrontend), some others only send data (e.g. VAudioDriver). Processing is normally driven from the input side - whenever data is pushed to the inputs, they will push the data on to the processor which will then do the processing with the data and then push the result to its outputs. There are exceptions, for example an audio driver receives sample data from an external source and pushes the data on to its outputs at the appropriate time. This class does all the admin related to input and output ports. Port objects can be accessed by index or by key. Index based access is useful a client wishes to enumerate all ports.
    Author:
    Peter Hoppe

      • VAudioProcessor

        public VAudioProcessor(java.lang.String id,
                       int nMaxChanIn,
                       int nMaxChanOut)
        cTor.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique ID under which we register this object with the registry.
        nMaxChanIn - Maximum number of input channels. Specify -1 for: No limit.
        nMaxChanOut - Maximum number of output channels. Specify -1 for: No limit.
